caption.p: Anti-inflammatory activities of S. cyclophylla extracts assessed via carrageenan-induced paw edema in rats. The values denoted are mean ± SEM, n = 6 animals/group. The statistical significance were performed via a one-way ANOVA followed by a posthoc test using Tukey’s multi-group comparison: ns: not significant, * p < 0.05, ** p < 0.01, *** p < 0.001, and **** p < 0.0001 compared to the olive oil group. For example, at 2 h compared to the olive oil control group, the diclofenac, aqueous-ethanolic, ethyl acetate, and chloroform groups were significantly different, * p < 0.0001.
